question: By whom was a 2013 American comedy film about a fake family smuggling in drugs from Mexico onto US soil directed which brought the BAFTA Rising Star Award to an English actor known for his work in the films "The Maze Runner" (2014), "Son of Rambow", "" (2010), "We're the Millers" (2013), "The Revenant" (2015), and "Detroit" (2017)?
context:
William Jack Poulter (born 28 January 1993) is an English actor known for his work in the films The Maze Runner (2014), Son of Rambow, The Chronicles of Narnia: The Voyage of the Dawn Treader (2010), We're the Millers (2013), The Revenant (2015), and Detroit (2017). For his work in We're the Millers, Poulter won the BAFTA Rising Star Award.

We're the Millers is a 2013 American comedy film directed by Rawson Marshall Thurber. The film's screenplay was written by Bob Fisher, Steve Faber, Sean Anders, and John Morris, based on a story by Fisher and Faber. It stars Jennifer Aniston, Jason Sudeikis, Emma Roberts, Will Poulter, Nick Offerman, Kathryn Hahn, Molly Quinn, and Ed Helms. The plot follows a small-time pot dealer (Sudeikis) who convinces his neighbors to help him by pretending to be his family, in order to smuggle drugs from Mexico into the United States.
